item.title: Jupyter Notebook and Spark With Docker Compose
item.description: Prerequisite Make sure you have docker compose installed on your machine. I assume you have docker compose V2 but V1 should also do the job. We both know you are just as lazy bastard as I am. So i will start with most important stuff: How to run 1. Create compose.yml file and add content above vim compose.yml compose.yml : services: spark-scala-notebook: build: context: . dockerfile: Dockerfile args: NB_UID: 1000 NB_GID: 1000 image: spark-scala-notebook:latest ports: - "8888:8888" environment: - JUPYTER_TOKEN= volumes: - .
